Privacy policy

This policy describes the organization's normal operating procedures for collecting
                        visitor
                        information from this website and linked third-party web apps.

UX4G is committed to preserving visitors' privacy when using the company's
                    official website and linked online apps. The user may choose to input information that is
                    both private and professional to fully utilize the service.

When a visitor performs actions like joining up, signing in, uploading information,
                    filling
                    out the form, uploading an image or document, submitting an online application / Email, or
                    interacting with us via the contact form, the organization collects information. Visitors
                    start website transactions, such as filling out and submitting registration or application
                    forms.
                    The organization also collects the visitor's email address and message content (including
                    attachments). This data is used to: Respond to the email. Address any concerns raised in the email. Send the information to the relevant department for screening, response, or other
                        action. Personal information should be kept for office records.
                        The organization is committed to not selling visitors' email addresses for commercial
                        purposes.

Respond to the email.

Address any concerns raised in the email.

Send the information to the relevant department for screening, response, or other
                        action.

Personal information should be kept for office records.
                        The organization is committed to not selling visitors' email addresses for commercial
                        purposes.

Information may be gathered in the form of preferences or permissions provided by
                    visitors
                    when they check in to the website. The visitor has the option of not completing such acts on
                    the official UX4G website. Failure to complete these tasks may preclude a visitor from
                    receiving particular information, services, or goods via the official UX4G website. However,
                    failing to perform these acts has no impact on activities like surfing and downloading.

Information

Visitors provide their personal information voluntarily through the following actions: Completing registration and signing in Information required for profile creation Filling out the application form

Completing registration and signing in

Information required for profile creation

Filling out the application form

Disclosure of Information

Disclosure of information only takes place after the consent of the visitor. The
                    voluntary submission of personal information by a visitor, whether solicited or unsolicited,
                    constitutes consent to the collecting and disclosure of the information by UX4G for the
                    purposes for which the visitor gave the information to UX4G.
                    UX4G can disclose the information without consent, to comply

UX4G can disclose the information without consent, to comply with the law against
                    unauthorized access to UX4G's assets.

Retention

All voluntarily provided information including personal information is retained by UX4G.
                    Visitors provide information to UX4G through processes including, but not limited to: Sending an email Filling profile creation form Filling out a survey or application form

Sending an email

Filling profile creation form

Filling out a survey or application form

Confidentiality and Legality

UX4G employs measures, such as but not limited to authentication, monitoring,
                    scanning,
                    auditing, and encryption, to protect the integrity of its information technology assets. As
                    part of the organization's ongoing commitment to the security of electronic content and the
                    electronic transmission of information, such security processes are incorporated into the
                    design, implementation, and day-to-day operations of official UX4G websites.
                    UX4G employs software to monitor traffic to detect unauthorized attempts to upload and
                    update information. This is done for website security reasons and to ensure the website's
                    availability.

Background

The policy informs the visitors about the technical information collected on the
                    concerned page. It also describes how personal information is collected while navigating the
                    website. Other website privacy notices include, but are not limited to cookies, and
                    third-party applications. Additional information exchange or disclosure may be covered in
                    these alerts.

Applicability

This privacy policy is only applicable to UX4G official website. It does not apply to
                    mobile
                    applications and other browser applications.

Need
                    Support?

Terms & Conditions

These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for the use of
                        UX4G's Website.

By accessing this website, we assume you accept these terms and conditions. Do not
                continue to use UX4G if you do not agree to take all the terms and conditions stated on this
                page.

The following terminology applies to these Terms and Conditions, Privacy Statement
                and Disclaimer Notice, and all Agreements: "Client", "You" and "Your" refers to you, the person
                who logged on to this website and is compliant with the Company's terms and conditions. "The
                Company", "Ourselves", "We", "Our" and "Us", refers to our Company. "Party", "Parties", or "Us",
                refers to both the Client and us. All terms refer to the offer, acceptance, and consideration of
                payment necessary to undertake the process of our assistance to the Client in the most
                appropriate manner for the express purpose of meeting the Client's needs in respect of the
                provision of the Company's stated services, by and subject to, prevailing law of Netherlands.
                Any use of the above terminology or other words in the singular, plural, capitalization, and/or
                he/she or they, are taken as interchangeable and therefore as referring to the same.

Cookies

We employ the use of cookies. By accessing UX4G, you agreed to use cookies in
                agreement with UX4G's Privacy Policy.Most interactive websites use cookies to let us retrieve
                the user's details for each visit. Cookies are used by our website to enable the functionality
                of certain areas to make it easier for people visiting our website. Some of our
                affiliate/advertising partners may also use cookies.

License

Unless otherwise stated, UX4G and/or its licensors own the intellectual
                property rights for all material on UX4G. All intellectual property rights are reserved. You may
                access this from UX4G for your personal use subject to restrictions set in these terms and
                conditions.

You must not: Republish material from UX4G Sell, rent, or sub-license material from UX4G Reproduce, duplicate or copy material from UX4G Redistribute content from UX4G

Republish material from UX4G

Sell, rent, or sub-license material from UX4G

Reproduce, duplicate or copy material from UX4G

Redistribute content from UX4G

Parts of this website offer an opportunity for users to post and exchange opinions
                and
                information in certain areas of the website. UX4G does not filter, edit, publish or review
                Comments before their presence on the website. Comments do not reflect the views and opinions of
                UX4G, its agents, and/or affiliates. Comments reflect the views and opinions of the person who
                posts their views and opinions. To the extent permitted by applicable laws, UX4G shall not be
                liable for the Comments, or any liability, damages, or expenses caused and/or suffered as a
                result of any use of and/or posting of and/or appearance of the Comments on this website.UX4G
                reserves the right to monitor all Comments and to remove any Comments which can be considered
                inappropriate, offensive, or causes a breach of these Terms and Conditions.

You warrant and represent that: You are entitled to post the Comments on our website and have all necessary licenses and
                    consents to do so; The Comments do not invade any intellectual property right, including without limitation
                    copyright, patent, or trademark of any third party. The Comments do not contain any defamatory, libelous, offensive, indecent, or otherwise
                    unlawful material which is an invasion of privacy The Comments will not be used to solicit or promote business or custom or present commercial
                    activities or unlawful activity.

You are entitled to post the Comments on our website and have all necessary licenses and
                    consents to do so;

The Comments do not invade any intellectual property right, including without limitation
                    copyright, patent, or trademark of any third party.

The Comments do not contain any defamatory, libelous, offensive, indecent, or otherwise
                    unlawful material which is an invasion of privacy

The Comments will not be used to solicit or promote business or custom or present commercial
                    activities or unlawful activity.

You hereby grant UX4G a non-exclusive license to use, reproduce, edit and authorize
                others to use, reproduce and edit any of your Comments in all forms, formats, or media.

Hyperlinking to our Content

The following organizations may link to our website without prior written
                approval: Government agencies. Search engines. News organizations. Online directory distributors may link to our website in the same manner as they hyperlink
                    to the Websites of other listed businesses; and

Government agencies.

Search engines.

News organizations.

Online directory distributors may link to our website in the same manner as they hyperlink
                    to the Websites of other listed businesses; and

These organizations may link to our home page, to publications, or other Website information so
                long
                as the link: (a) is not in any way deceptive; (b) does not falsely imply sponsorship,
                endorsement,
                or approval of the linking party and its products and/or services; and (c) fits within the
                context
                of the linking party’s site.

We may consider and approve other link requests from the following types of
                organizations: commonly-known consumer and/or business information sources. dot.com community sites. associations or other groups representing charities. online directory distributors. internet portals. accounting, law and consulting firms; and educational institutions and trade associations.

dot.com community sites.

associations or other groups representing charities.

online directory distributors.

internet portals.

accounting, law and consulting firms; and

educational institutions and trade associations.

We will approve link requests from these organizations if we decide that: (a) the link would
                not make us look unfavorably to ourselves or our accredited businesses; (b) the organization
                does
                not have any negative records with us; (c) the benefit to us from the visibility of the
                hyperlink
                compensates the absence of UX4G; and (d) the link is in the context of general resource
                information.
                We will approve link requests from these organizations if we decide that: (a) the link would not
                make us look unfavorably to ourselves or our accredited businesses; (b) the organization does
                not
                have any negative records with us; (c) the benefit to us from the visibility of the hyperlink
                compensates the absence of UX4G; and (d) the link is in the context of general resource
                information.

These organizations may link to our home page so long as the link: (a) is not in any
                way
                deceptive; (b) does not falsely imply sponsorship, endorsement, or approval of the linking party
                and its products or services; and (c) fits within the context of the linking party’s site.

If you are one of the organizations listed in paragraph 2 above and are interested
                in linking to our website, you must inform us by sending an eURLs from which you intend to link
                to our website, and a list of the URLs on our site to which you would like to link. Wait 2-3
                weeks for a response.-mail to UX4G. Please include your
                name, your organization name, and contact information as well as the URL of your site, a list of
                any URLs from which you intend to link to our website, and a list of the URLs on our site to
                which you would like to link. Wait 2-3 weeks for a response.

Approved organizations may hyperlink to our website as follows: By use of our corporate name; or By use of the uniform resource locator being linked to; or By use of any other description of our website being linked to that makes sense within the
                    context and format of content on the linking party’s site.

By use of our corporate name; or

By use of the uniform resource locator being linked to; or

By use of any other description of our website being linked to that makes sense within the
                    context and format of content on the linking party’s site.

No use of UX4G's logo or other artwork will be allowed for linking absent a
                trademark license
                agreement.

iFrames

Without prior approval and written permission, you may not create frames around our
                Webpages that
                alter in any way the visual presentation or appearance of our website.

Content Liability

We shall not be held responsible for any content that appears on your Website. You
                agree to protect and defend us against all claims that are rising on your Website. No link(s)
                should appear on any Website that may be interpreted as libelous, obscene, or criminal, or which
                infringes, otherwise violates, or advocates the infringement or other violation of, any
                third-party rights.

Your Privacy

Please read Privacy Policy

Reservation of Rights

We reserve the right to request that you remove all links to our website. You
                approve of immediately removing all links to our Website upon request. We also reserve the right
                to amend these terms and conditions and its linking policy at any time. By continuously linking
                to our website, you agree to be bound to and follow these linking terms and conditions.

Removal of links from our website

If you find any link on our website that is offensive for any reason, you are free
                to contact and inform us at any moment. We will consider requests to remove links, but we are
                not obligated to or so or to respond to you directly.

We do not ensure that the information on this website is correct, we do not warrant
                its
                completeness or accuracy; nor do we promise to ensure that the website remains available or that
                the material on the website is kept up to date.

Disclaimer

To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, we exclude all representations,
                warranties, and conditions relating to our website and the use of this website. Nothing in this
                disclaimer will: limit or exclude our or your liability for death or personal injury. limit or exclude our or your liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation. limit any of our or your liabilities in any way that is not permitted under applicable law,
                    or exclude any of our or your liabilities that may not be excluded under applicable law.

exclude any of our or your liabilities that may not be excluded under applicable law.

The limitations and prohibitions of liability set in this Section and elsewhere in
                this
                disclaimer:
                (a) are subject to the preceding paragraph; and (b) govern all liabilities arising under the
                disclaimer, including liabilities arising in contract, in tort, and for breach of statutory
                duty.

If the website and the information and services on the website are provided free of
                charge, we
                will not be liable for any loss or damage of any nature.

Related Links

Explore the links below to improve User Experience and implement various tools and resources for
                        creating user-friendly digital interfaces, as well as to encourage and simplify collaboration
                        among various designers, developers, and service experiences.

Ensure your website meets the latest Government of India standards for accessibility, security, and usability with GIGW 3.0.

An initiative by the Indian government to standardize and improve the quality and accessibility of
                    government websites

A set of handbook aimed at making web content more accessible to people with disabilities by
                    focusing on these four principles: perceivable, operable, understandable and robust.

The Act regulates digital personal data processing, balancing individuals data protection rights
                    with lawful processing needs

MeitY promotes e-Governance to empower citizens, drive inclusive and sustainable growth in the
                    Electronics, IT, and ITeS industries, and enhance India’s role in Internet Governance.

NeGD supports MeitY in programme management, offers technical and advisory support to
                    ministries/departments at both the central and state levels, as well as other government
                    organizations

DIC provides strategic support to central and state ministries and departments through capacity
                    building for e-governance projects, promoting best practices, encouraging public-private
                    partnerships and fostering innovation and technology across various domains

A flagship programme of the Government of India with a vision to transform India into a digitally
                    empowered society and knowledge economy

NSSO provides critical data for policy formulation and planning, significantly contributing to
                    statistical analysis and reporting in India

UMANG is a unified mobile app launched by MeitY to provide Indian citizens with access to various
                    government services from the central, state and local governments

DigiLocker is a key initiative under Digital India, offering citizens a secure cloud-based platform
                    to store, share and verify documents and certificates

STQC offers quality assurance services in IT and electronics through testing, certification and
                    quality audits

India.gov.in is the national portal of India, providing a single window access to information and
                    services offered by the Indian government

UXDT leads the design and development of user-centered interfaces for NIC applications

Sustainable Development Goals

Apply Now 2026

“Emerging trends in Free Legal Aid: The road forward.”

Name of Event: Guest Lecture (Tentative Date: 24 May, 2022).

“Emerging trends in Free Legal Aid: The road forward.”

Event Brief: The Constitution of India empowers the citizens under Article 39A which says “State shall secure that the operation of the legal system promotes justice on a basis of equal opportunity, and shall in particular, provide free legal aid, by suitable legislation or schemes or in any other way, to ensure that opportunities for securing justice are not denied to any citizen by reason of economic or other disability”. Under this purview this guest lecture aims to not only make the participants aware of the rights but also bring to their knowledge the procedure to access free legal aid. Not limiting to this to also look forward to new dimensions that can be worked upon in the field of legal aid

Purpose: Making the participants aware of their rights which they as citizens/foreigners/non-citizens can access. Bringing to light specifically The Right to Free Legal Aid present in every court in India.

Organized By : School of Law and Legal Affairs, NIU Greater Noida

Name of Guest Speaker:Mr. Jai Hind Kumar Singh, Secretary DALSA, PCS(J)

Guest Profile: Mr. JK. Singh completed his graduation in science (B.Sc.) in the year 2002, then joined LL. B. and completed in the year2007 with a shining First Division. He added another feather in his cap by completing LL.M.in the year 2009. In the year 2013 he took his first posting as Addl. Civil Judge (Junior Division) Mau. Since then there has been no looking back. Presently he is serving as Secretary District Legal Service Authority, Gautam Budh University. He recently completed his 9 years of service in Judicial Services on 20-5-2022.

Event coordinator: Lovish Minocha, Ms Shusneha

Contact Us

Admission Helpline : (+91) 8745862200 (+91) 0120-4862200

Email Id : admissions@niu.edu.in internationaladmissions@niu.edu.in

Empanelment by NeGD

National e-Governance Division

In 2009, the National e-Governance Division was created by the Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology as an independent business division under the Digital India Corporation (erstwhile Media Lab Asia), a Section 8 not-for-profit company. Since 2009, NeGD has been playing a pivotal role in supporting MeitY in programme management and implementation of e-Governance projects, providing technical and advisory support to ministries/departments, both at central and state levels, along with other government organisations.

India Stack Global has been launched to showcase the India Stack and its building blocks globally.

Entity Locker is a pioneering addition to the DigiLocker family, a cornerstone initiative of the Digital India campaign.

This is a user authentication service in which a single set of credentials provides access to multiple online applications or services.

Launched by the Hon’ble Prime Minister, myScheme is a marketplace for schemes.

API Setu is an Open API Platform from the Ministry of Electronics and IT, Government of India.

An initiative under the Digital India Programme prioritizes users’ needs by implementing a citizen-centric approach to User Experience (UX).

The objective of the OpenForge platform is to promote the sharing and reuse of e-governance application source code.

UMANG is a unified portal aggregating major citizen-centric services of central and state governments, local, autonomous & statutory bodies through mobile apps (Android & iOS) and the web.

Targeted at the idea of paperless governance, DigiLocker is a platform for the issuance and verification of documents & certificates digitally, thus eliminating the use of physical documents.

NeGD Dashboards

Training Programmes

Get a data-driven glimpse of trainings in Capacity Building project and participation across nation. Explore key insights and trends shaping capacity-building efforts.

Courses in i-Got

Access a comprehensive dashboard showcasing course enrollments, completions, and feedback on the digital learning content.

State e-Mission Team

Explore state/UT-wise deployment of SeMTs at a glance. Visualize the reach and presence of digital governance teams driving transformation across India.

DigiLocker

Along with summary, get an integrated view of issuers, requestors, cloud usage trends, and ticket management, enabling stakeholders to track performance, monitor adoption, and ensure seamless service delivery.

Events/ Workshops/ Activities

Explore details of all events including conferences, workshops, talk shows and Ask Our Experts.

What's New

Content Writer

Head SeMT

What We Do

Digital India Corporation (DIC) leads and guides in realizing the vision,
                    objectives
                    and goals of the Digital India program. It provides the strategic support to
                    Ministries/Departments of Centre/States for carrying forward the mission of Digital India by way
                    of Capacity Building for e-Governance projects, promoting best practices, encouraging
                    Public-Private Partnerships (PPP), nurturing innovation and technology in various domains.

Digital Infrastructure

Health

Education

Livelihood

Social Empowerment

Digital Infrastructure

The Digital Infrastructure developed by DIC aims to bridge the gap between the government and citizens while eliminating intermediaries and empowering citizens with safe and secure digital platforms for day-to-day use.

The intervention of technology and innovation has been leveraged to bring about Government services at the fingertips of the citizens of the country, ensuring comfort, convenience, and ease of access.

API Setu | DigiLocker | MeriPehchaan | OpenForge | Poshan Tracker

Health

Health integration plays a pivotal role in promoting a holistic approach to healthcare and nutrition services. The healthcare system is developed with the objective of improving health-seeking behavior and empowering the community in self-assessment, as well as self-referral, to prevent avoidable health risks.

Developing digital public infrastructure and goods for health is also one of the major focus areas of DIC, which includes the development of portals and platforms for core medical departments, as well as creating knowledge and awareness about Ayush for improving lifestyle and well-being.

Ayusoft | Ayush Global Portal | AIH | DigiDrishti

Education

Constructing a well-educated society is imperative to enhance lifestyles and foster a developed economy in India. Recognizing the necessity to cultivate young minds, DIC is consistently working towards revolutionizing and reforming the educational landscape of India.

DIC employs an integrated approach with the objective of empowering Indian citizens by offering digital solutions to streamline their work and boost productivity and livelihood, with a particular emphasis on farmers, artisans, weavers, urban workers, and marginalized communities.

ABC | DIKSHA | PhD Scheme | Punarjjani

Livelihood

DIC is working tirelessly towards uplifting grassroots-level sections of society and improving their livelihoods by providing means to communicate with experts, enhance their skills, and connect with their potential customer base.

DIC employs an integrated approach with the objective of empowering Indian citizens by providing digital solutions to ease their job and enhance their productivity and livelihood, with a special focus on farmers, artisans, weavers, urban workers, and marginalized communities.

Chic - CAD Plus | DigiBunai | MY Bharat

Social Empowerment

Social empowerment initiatives from DIC are aimed at bringing about a positive impact on the lives of Indian citizens by facilitating the upliftment of the weaker sections of society and helping them achieve self-sufficiency.

Through projects focused on social empowerment, the platform provides detailed information about government scheme benefits to the targeted audience. DIC has been actively involved in the identification, ideation, design, and implementation of schemes and projects related to social upbringing and empowerment.

MyScheme | UMANG | M4Agri | Kisan Sarathi | NCW

DIKSHA

DIKSHA (Digital Infrastructure for Knowledge Sharing) is a national platform for school education, an initiative of National Council for Educational Research and Training (NCERT), under the aegis of the Ministry of Education (MoE), GoI.

1,136

Courses

183.6 M

Enrolments

146.3 M

Course Completions

UMANG

UMANG is a unified Portal aggregating major citizen centric services of the Government, Local, Autonomous & Statutory Bodies through mobile apps and web. The objective is to improve ease-of-living by putting power in the hands of citizens for availing major government services.

96.9M

Registrations

6,882.4M

Transactions

2363

Services

240

Departments/Entities

DigiLocker

DigiLocker aims at ‘Digital Empowerment’ of citizen by providing access to authentic digital documents to citizen’s digital document wallet. The issued documents are deemed to be at par with original physical documents as per Rule 9A of the IT Rules.

8,408.5M

Issued Documents

2.3K

Issuers

1.0K

Orgnization

Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme

“Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronic & IT”, with the approval of Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, was initiated in 2014 with an objective to enhance no. of PhDs in the country (Budget: Rs. 466 Cr). PhD seats were allocated to 97 institutions in 25 states and 4 Union Territories.

5750

Research Publications

795

PhD Completed

32

Thesis Submitted

MY Bharat

Mera Yuva Bharat (MY Bharat) is an autonomous body that has been set up by the Government of India to provide an over-arching institutional mechanism powered by technology for youth development and youth-led development.

17.11 M

Total Registrations

115.08 K

Organizations Registrations

360.40 K

Total Opportunities

MeriPehchaan

MeriPehchaan (NSSO) is a user authentication service in which single set of credentials provides access to multiple online or services applications. It offers benefits such as strengthening password policy, reducing risk of data breach, centralized access control and ease of doing business.

585.6M

Total Enrolled Users

947.4M

Total Transactions

11.2K

Total Service Registered

LokOS

LokOS (Lok = People, OS = Operating System) is a Profile Management and Financial Operational System for the rural Community based Organizations or CBOs in India. LokOS is a national platform for the CBOs under National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM).

Poshan Tracker

The ‘Poshan Tracker’ is a mobile based application rolled out by the Ministry of Women and Child Development. Te technology under Poshan Tracker is being leveraged for dynamic identification of stunting, wasting, under-weight prevalence among children.

1.40 M

Anganwadi Centers

1.33 M

Anganwadi Workers

86.98 M

Eligible Beneficiaries

DIKSHA

UMANG

DigiLocker

PhD Scheme

MY Bharat

What's New

ABOUT STQC Directorate

Standardisation Testing and Quality Certification (STQC) Directorate, an attached office of Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India, is a leading organization for Quality Assurance services in the field of Electronics and Information Technology.

Through an extensive network of laboratories and centres located across the country, STQC excels in providing a diverse range of services such as Testing, Calibration, IT & e-Governance, Certification, and Capacity Building to Public as well as Private organizations.

READ MORE

Shri Narendra Modi

Hon'ble Prime Minister of India

Shri Ashwini Vaishnaw

Hon'ble Minister of Railways; lnformation and Broadcasting; and Electronics and Information Technology

Shri Jitin Prasada

Hon'ble Minister of State in the Ministry of Commerce and Industry; and Electronics and Information Technology

ABOUT DIGILOCKER

Document Wallet to Empower
                                Citizens

DigiLocker is a flagship initiative of Ministry of Electronics & IT (MeitY) under Digital India programme. DigiLocker aims at 'Digital Empowerment' of citizen by providing access to authentic digital documents to citizen's digital
                            document wallet. DigiLocker is a secure cloud based platform for storage, sharing and verification of documents & certificates.

55+ Crore

Registered Users

800+ Crore

Issued Documents

Getting started is quick and easy

Register Yourself

Verify Yourself

Fetch Your Documents

Share Your Documents

Become a
                                        DigiLocker Partner Organization

Get registered as a DigiLocker Issuer or Requester!

Download DigiLocker App

DigiLocker aims at 'Digital Empowerment' by providing access to authentic digital documents to the citizen's digital document wallet.

Guest Lecture on Emerging Trends in Free Legal Aid – The Road Forward

Date: 24.05.2022 REPORT on Guest Lecture on Emerging Trends in Free Legal Aid – The Road Forward On the 24 th of May, 2022, a Guest Lecture was organized by School of Law and Legal Affairs, Noida International University at 12 noon onwards in the seminar hall. On the topic “Emerging Trends in Free Legal Aid: The Road Forward”. The resource person for the event was Learned Shri Jaihind Kumar Singh, Secretary District Legal services Authority (DLSA) (PCS)J, Gautam Buddh Nagar, Uttar Pradesh. The event was conducted under the patronage of Dr. Devesh Kumar Singh, Hon’ble Chairman, Noida International University, Dr. Vikram Singh, Hon’ble Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. (Dr.) Uma Bharadwaj (Chief Patron of the Event), Vice Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. Dr. Parsanjeet Kumar, (Patron of the Event), Pro Vice Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. (Dr.) Manu Singh, (Patron of the Event) Director, School of Law and Legal Affairs, Noida International University. The Event Coordinators were Ms. Shusneha Sarkar, Assistant Professor in Law, School of Law & Legal Aaffairs, Noida International University and Ms. Lovish Minocha, Guest Lecturer, School of Law & Legal Aaffairs, Noida International University. The session was anchored and hosted by Ms. Shusneha Sarkar. The Hon’ble resource person explained the concepts of Legal Aid, Arbitration, Paralegal Services, Lok Adalat, etc, and also threw light on the aspects of procedures of Mediation, participation of the students in free Legal Aid for helping the needy and the downtrodden masses of the society. These pertinent issues discussed in the lecture has aided the students in gaining better understanding and profound knowledge about DLSA, SLSA, NLSA and also encourage them to participate in further Legal activities. The Learned Resource Person highlighted the aspects of Legal Services for providing free legal aid, spreading legal awareness, organization of Lok Adalats, Promoting alternative solutions for dispute resolution, to provide compensation to victims of crime, etc. He also gave a clear picture regarding the following categories who are eligible for free Legal Aid Services like the women and children, member of SC ST, industrial workers, victims of nature calamity like industrial disaster, flood, etc., physically disabled persons, person in custody. Free legal service is provided for all civil, criminal, revenue, and administrative cases. For which the following legal service organizations have been established to get free legal services at national level- national legal service authority, at state level- state legal service authority, at district level- district legal service authority, at sub division and taluka level- sub division/ taluka committee legal service authority, at high court level- high court committee legal service authority, at supreme court level- supreme court committee legal service authority. The session was attended by more than 100 Law students from the department of SLLA from different Courses like B.A.LL.B., B.B.A.LL.B. , LL.B. and  LL.M. The session was very interactive and proved to be a successful one. The session ended with a formal vote of thanks to the Chair by Ms. Lovish Minocha. Share this post

Date: 24.05.2022

REPORT

on

Guest Lecture on Emerging Trends in Free Legal Aid – The Road Forward

On the 24 th of May, 2022, a Guest Lecture was organized by School of Law and Legal Affairs, Noida International University at 12 noon onwards in the seminar hall. On the topic “Emerging Trends in Free Legal Aid: The Road Forward”. The resource person for the event was Learned Shri Jaihind Kumar Singh, Secretary District Legal services Authority (DLSA) (PCS)J, Gautam Buddh Nagar, Uttar Pradesh. The event was conducted under the patronage of Dr. Devesh Kumar Singh, Hon’ble Chairman, Noida International University, Dr. Vikram Singh, Hon’ble Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. (Dr.) Uma Bharadwaj (Chief Patron of the Event), Vice Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. Dr. Parsanjeet Kumar, (Patron of the Event), Pro Vice Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. (Dr.) Manu Singh, (Patron of the Event) Director, School of Law and Legal Affairs, Noida International University. The Event Coordinators were Ms. Shusneha Sarkar, Assistant Professor in Law, School of Law & Legal Aaffairs, Noida International University and Ms. Lovish Minocha, Guest Lecturer, School of Law & Legal Aaffairs, Noida International University. The session was anchored and hosted by Ms. Shusneha Sarkar. The Hon’ble resource person explained the concepts of Legal Aid, Arbitration, Paralegal Services, Lok Adalat, etc, and also threw light on the aspects of procedures of Mediation, participation of the students in free Legal Aid for helping the needy and the downtrodden masses of the society. These pertinent issues discussed in the lecture has aided the students in gaining better understanding and profound knowledge about DLSA, SLSA, NLSA and also encourage them to participate in further Legal activities. The Learned Resource Person highlighted the aspects of Legal Services for providing free legal aid, spreading legal awareness, organization of Lok Adalats, Promoting alternative solutions for dispute resolution, to provide compensation to victims of crime, etc. He also gave a clear picture regarding the following categories who are eligible for free Legal Aid Services like the women and children, member of SC ST, industrial workers, victims of nature calamity like industrial disaster, flood, etc., physically disabled persons, person in custody. Free legal service is provided for all civil, criminal, revenue, and administrative cases. For which the following legal service organizations have been established to get free legal services at national level- national legal service authority, at state level- state legal service authority, at district level- district legal service authority, at sub division and taluka level- sub division/ taluka committee legal service authority, at high court level- high court committee legal service authority, at supreme court level- supreme court committee legal service authority. The session was attended by more than 100 Law students from the department of SLLA from different Courses like B.A.LL.B., B.B.A.LL.B. , LL.B. and  LL.M. The session was very interactive and proved to be a successful one. The session ended with a formal vote of thanks to the Chair by Ms. Lovish Minocha. Share this post

On the 24 th of May, 2022, a Guest Lecture was organized by School of Law and Legal Affairs, Noida International University at 12 noon onwards in the seminar hall. On the topic “Emerging Trends in Free Legal Aid: The Road Forward”.

The resource person for the event was Learned Shri Jaihind Kumar Singh, Secretary District Legal services Authority (DLSA) (PCS)J, Gautam Buddh Nagar, Uttar Pradesh. The event was conducted under the patronage of Dr. Devesh Kumar Singh, Hon’ble Chairman, Noida International University, Dr. Vikram Singh, Hon’ble Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. (Dr.) Uma Bharadwaj (Chief Patron of the Event), Vice Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. Dr. Parsanjeet Kumar, (Patron of the Event), Pro Vice Chancellor, Noida International University, Prof. (Dr.) Manu Singh, (Patron of the Event) Director, School of Law and Legal Affairs, Noida International University. The Event Coordinators were Ms. Shusneha Sarkar, Assistant Professor in Law, School of Law & Legal Aaffairs, Noida International University and Ms. Lovish Minocha, Guest Lecturer, School of Law & Legal Aaffairs, Noida International University. The session was anchored and hosted by Ms. Shusneha Sarkar.

The Hon’ble resource person explained the concepts of Legal Aid, Arbitration, Paralegal Services, Lok Adalat, etc, and also threw light on the aspects of procedures of Mediation, participation of the students in free Legal Aid for helping the needy and the downtrodden masses of the society. These pertinent issues discussed in the lecture has aided the students in gaining better understanding and profound knowledge about DLSA, SLSA, NLSA and also encourage them to participate in further Legal activities.

The Learned Resource Person highlighted the aspects of Legal Services for providing free legal aid, spreading legal awareness, organization of Lok Adalats, Promoting alternative solutions for dispute resolution, to provide compensation to victims of crime, etc.

He also gave a clear picture regarding the following categories who are eligible for free Legal Aid Services like the women and children, member of SC ST, industrial workers, victims of nature calamity like industrial disaster, flood, etc., physically disabled persons, person in custody.

Free legal service is provided for all civil, criminal, revenue, and administrative cases. For which the following legal service organizations have been established to get free legal services

at national level- national legal service authority, at state level- state legal service authority, at district level- district legal service authority, at sub division and taluka level- sub division/ taluka committee legal service authority, at high court level- high court committee legal service authority, at supreme court level- supreme court committee legal service authority.

The session was attended by more than 100 Law students from the department of SLLA from different Courses like B.A.LL.B., B.B.A.LL.B. , LL.B. and  LL.M. The session was very interactive and proved to be a successful one. The session ended with a formal vote of thanks to the Chair by Ms. Lovish Minocha.

The future of building happens together

Tools and trends evolve, but collaboration endures. With GitHub, developers, agents, and code come together on one platform.

GitHub features

GitHub customers

Accelerate your entire workflow

From your first line of code to final deployment, GitHub provides AI and automation tools to help you build and ship better software faster.

Your AI partner everywhere. Copilot is ready to work with you at each step of the software development lifecycle.

Duolingo boosts developer speed by 25% with GitHub Copilot

2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for AI Code Assistants

Ship faster with secure, reliable CI/CD.

Keep momentum on the go

Shape your toolchain

Built-in application security where found means fixed

Use AI to find and fix vulnerabilities so your team can ship more secure software faster.

Apply fixes in seconds. Spend less time debugging and more time building features with Copilot Autofix.

Security debt, solved. Leverage security campaigns and Copilot Autofix to reduce application vulnerabilities.

Dependencies you can depend on. Update vulnerable dependencies with supported fixes for breaking changes.

Your secrets, your business. Detect, prevent, and remediate leaked secrets across your organization.

70% MTTR reduction with Copilot Autofix

8.3M secret leaks stopped in the past 12 months with push protection

Work together, achieve more

From planning and discussion to code review, GitHub keeps your team’s conversation and context next to your code.

Plan with clarity. Organize everything from high-level roadmaps to everyday tasks.

========================================================================================================================
URL: https://www.digilocker.gov.in/assets/DIGILOCKER%20ASK%20EXPERT.pdf (binary saved at: C:\Users\akmbu\OneDrive\Desktop\scraper\fullscraper\downloaded_files\1763804206_DIGILOCKER%20ASK%20EXPERT.pdf)
STATUS: 200
CONTENT-TYPE: application/pdf
FETCHED-AT: 2025-11-22T09:36:46.397618Z
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Answers  to  questions  asked  during  'Ask  our  Experts'  YouTube 

Live Show on DigiLocker on October 18, 2024 

Question  1:  What  should  I  do  if  there  is  a  name  mismatch  between  my 

Aadhaar and my degree certificates? 

Example: 

Aadhaar Name: Given Name + Father’s Name + Surname/Family Name 

Degree Certificate Name: Surname/Family Name + Given Name + Father’s 

Name 

Answer: As you may be aware, DigiLocker requires matching your name to 

ensure  that  only  the  rightful  owner  can  access  their  documents.  For  a 

document to be fetched from DigiLocker, the name on the document must 

match the name on your Aadhaar. In case of a name mismatch, you will not 

be able to pull your document from DigiLocker.  

Question 2: If I have an account with one mobile number linked to Aadhaar 

and  my  Driving  Licence  is  linked  to  another  number,  can  I  retrieve  my 

Driving Licence in my current DigiLocker account? 

Answer: Yes, you can log in to your DigiLocker account linked with Aadhaar 

on  the  DigiLocker  website  (www.digilocker.gov.in).  Use  the 

'Search 

Document'  option  on  the  left,  select  'Ministry  of  Road  Transport  and 

Highways,'  click  on  'Driving  Licence  Verification  Record,'  and  enter  your 

licence number to retrieve it. 

1 

 
 
 
 
 
Question 3: When will the Academic Bank of Credits (ABC) ID be functional 

in all government institutes? 

Answer:  The  Ministry  of  Education  (MoE)  aims 

to  complete 

the 

implementation of ABC across all government institutes soon. The process 

is underway to ensure seamless access for students nationwide. 

Question 4: Why do I see the message "school students should contact their 

respective schools" when trying to create my APAAR ID? 

Answer: Students under the age of 16 cannot create their APAAR ID directly 

through the DigiLocker app or website. If you are eligible and still face issues, 

please reach out to your school for assistance in creating your APAAR ID. 

Question 5: What should I do if my 12th Mark Sheet has not been uploaded 

on DigiLocker by my college? 

Answer:  Only  the  authorized  board  or  university  can  upload  data  on 

DigiLocker. If your 12th Mark Sheet is missing, please contact your board and 

request them to make the data available on DigiLocker. 

Question  6:  Why  aren’t  my  state’s  educational  documents  like  10th  &  12th 

Mark Sheets or degree certificates, available on DigiLocker? 

Answer: Digital records are available on DigiLocker only if the institution has 

uploaded  its  records  to  the  National  Academic  Depository  (NAD).  If  your 

documents are missing, please contact your university or board and request 

them to provide their digital records on NAD for access via DigiLocker. 

2 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  7:  Can  we  trust  that  our  data  and  privacy  are  safe  on  the 

DigiLocker digital cloud? Is there legal protection against hacking? 

Answer:  DigiLocker  is  designed  with  robust  security  measures  to  ensure 

data and privacy protection. Key practices include: 

Standard  Security  Practices:  Adherence  to  coding  standards,  internal 

security reviews, and regular penetration testing. 

2048-Bit SSL Encryption: Ensures secure data transmission. 

Multi-Factor Authentication: Includes OTP, biometric, and PIN validation for 

sign-up and sign-in. 

ISO 27001 Certified Hosting: Data is stored in secure, certified facilities. 

Data Redundancy: Backups with multi-zone redundancy for data protection. 

Timed Log Out: Automatic session termination after inactivity. 

Security Audits: Conducted regularly by CERT-IN empanelled agencies and 

third parties. 

User Consent: Data is shared only with explicit user consent, and all access 

is logged. 

These  measures  ensure  that  DigiLocker  is  safe  and  legally  compliant, 

offering strong data protection for its users. 

Question 8: Hello, I graduated from RTU Kota in 2011 and completed my 10th 

and  12th  from  the  Rajasthan  Board.  How  can  I  get  my  digital  documents 

from the issuer on DigiLocker? 

Answer:  Digital  records  are  available  on  DigiLocker  only  if  the  issuing 

institution  has  uploaded  its  records  to  the  National  Academic  Depository 

(NAD).  To  access  your  documents  digitally,  please  contact  the  Rajasthan 

Board and RTU Kota, requesting them to provide their records on NAD. 

3 

 
 
 
 
 
Question 9: After uploading my class results data at Sangam University, I 

noticed that the generated grade sheets are not organized in any sequence 

by enrolment number or ABC ID. What should I do? 

Answer:  Please  raise  a  ticket  at  https://support.digilocker.gov.in/  and 

provide the following details: 

A scanned copy of the mark sheet/certificate or your full name as it appears 

on the document 

Education board name 

Year of passing/session/month 

Roll number/registration number/seat number 

Serial number on the document 

Total marks 

Your registered mobile number 

A screenshot of the error 

Providing these details will help the support team address and resolve the 

issue. 

Question 10: I received a discrepancy error during the upload of results in 

DigiLocker due to a name mismatch between my Aadhaar and the name 

submitted. How can I resolve this issue? 

Answer:  DigiLocker  requires  matching  of  name  to  ensure  that  only  the 

rightful  owner  can  access  their  documents.  The  name  on  your  document 

must match the name on your Aadhaar. To resolve this discrepancy, you will 

need to update either your Aadhaar or the name on the document to ensure 

they match. Once corrected, you should be able to access your document 

from DigiLocker. 

4 

 
 
 
 
 
Question 11: Is it mandatory to upload documents on DigiLocker, or can we 

upload data on ABC and have it automatically visible on DigiLocker? This 

question pertains to student records, such as degree certificates. 

Answer: No, it is not mandatory to upload documents directly on DigiLocker. 

Data  uploaded  on  the  Academic  Bank  of  Credits  (ABC)  will  be  visible  on 

DigiLocker if it is seeded with the ABC or APAAR ID. This ensures that students 

can access their records seamlessly through DigiLocker. 

!" 12: !बहार बोड( क* 10व, और 12व, क* माक( शीट 2021 के  बाद क* उपल7 नह, है। वष( 

चयन के  समय वहां वष( का !वक@ आता ही नह,। Cा इसका कोई समाधान है? 

उ$र:  कृ पा %ान  द(  )क  )बहार -ू ल  ए1ा2मनेशन  बोड8  ने  9सफ8   2018 और  2019  के   2लए

Question  13:  I  passed  out  in  2005  and  2007  from  RBSE  for  10th  and  12th 

classes, but I can't get these documents on DigiLocker.   

Answer: The Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education has digital records for 

2014-2021  and  2023.  You  may  request  them  to  make  earlier  records 

available. 

Question 14: How can we add an SSC certificate from 1991 to DigiLocker?   

Answer:  Digital  records  are  only  available  if  the  institution  has  uploaded 

them to NAD. You can request your board to publish digital records through 

DigiLocker. 

5 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
!" 15: अगर !कसी का Iडजीलॉकर पर पहले  से अकाउं ट बना हो और पासवड( भूल जाए, तो 

Cा वह "Forgot Password" करके  अपने दOावेज़Q को सुरSTत Uप से ढू

ंढ सकते हW?

से ढू

ंढ सकते हC। 9सXो=रटी )पन रीसेट करने के  2लए नीचे Zदए गए [े\ फॉलो कर(:  

1.  https://www.digilocker.gov.in/  पर  लॉग  ऑन  कर(  और  साइन  इन  पर  ‘aक

कर(। 

Question 16: How can DigiLocker help in making Digital India paperless, and 

when can we expect to see this transformation? 

Answer: DigiLocker is a key driver of a paperless Digital India by providing a 

secure and accessible platform for storing, sharing, and accessing official 

documents as mentioned below: 

Digital Document Storage:  Securely  store  government-issued  documents 

like  Aadhaar,  licenses,  and  certificates,  eliminating  the  need  for  physical 

copies. 

Instant  Access  &  Sharing:  Access  and  share  documents  anytime, 

anywhere, streamlining processes and reducing paper dependency. 

Government  Services  Integration:  Receive  and  store  digital  government 

documents such as pension papers and health records, minimizing paper 

workflows. 

6 

 
 
 
 
Paperless Verification: Secure, online document verification eliminates the 

need for physical submissions, enhancing efficiency. 

Environmental & Cost Benefits: Reduces paper waste, cuts costs, and saves 

time in document storage and processing. 

DigiLocker  is  accelerating  the  shift  towards  a  paperless  India,  supporting 

both  environmental  sustainability  and  administrative  efficiency.  As  for  the 

timeline,  the  continued  integration  of  services  and  awareness  efforts  will 

pave the way for a more paperless society in the coming years. 

Question 17: What are the benefits of DigiLocker, and is it mandatory for all 

citizens of India? 

Answer: DigiLocker offers numerous benefits, including: 

Secure Storage: Users can securely store and access important documents 

like Aadhaar, driving license, and educational certificates in digital format, 

eliminating the need for physical copies. 

Simplified  Sharing: 

It  simplifies  document  sharing  with  government 

departments and businesses, ensuring authenticity and reducing the risk of 

fraud. 

Integration with Government Services: DigiLocker is integrated with various 

government  services,  providing  convenient  access  and  saving  time  for 

users. 

Enhanced Security: It offers secure storage through encryption, multifactor 

authentication,  and  regular  audits,  ensuring  that  your  documents  are 

protected. 

Please note that DigiLocker is not mandatory for all citizens of India; it is an 

optional  service  designed  to  enhance  convenience  and  security 

in 

document management. 

7 

 
 
 
 
 
Question  18:  If  there  is  a  name  mismatch  between  my  Aadhaar  and  my 

university  certificates  (e.g.,  my  B.Sc.  and  M.Sc.  certificates),  how  can  I 

retrieve these certificates in DigiLocker? 

Answer:  Please  note,  in  cases  of  a  name  mismatch,  you  won’t  be  able  to 

fetch documents from DigiLocker. The name on the document must match 

the name on your Aadhaar. Please reach out to your institution if you need 

further guidance on updating your name. 

Question 19: Foreign students who are currently enrolled—what assistance 

can  be  provided  to  help  them  register  for  an  APAAR  ID  without  Aadhaar 

details? 

Answer:  We  are  in  the  process  of  establishing  a  procedure  for  creating 

APAAR  IDs  specifically  for  foreign  students.  Further  guidelines  and  support 

will be made available soon to facilitate their registration without Aadhaar 

details. Please stay tuned for updates regarding this process 

Question  20:  As  students  are  advised  to  have  DigiLocker,  can  we  create 

multiple accounts using a single mobile number? 

Answer:  Yes,  users  can  create  up  to  five  Aadhaar-verified  DigiLocker 

accounts  using  a  single  mobile  number.  However,  only  one  non-verified 

DigiLocker  account  can  be  created  with  the  same  mobile  number.  This 

system  allows  flexibility  in  managing  multiple  DigiLocker  accounts  while 

ensuring security and proper authentication through Aadhaar verification. 

8 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  21:  Foreign  students  currently  enrolled  at  Sangam  University—

what  assistance  can  be  provided  to  help  them  register  for  an  APAAR  ID 

without Aadhaar details? 

Answer:  Please  raise  your  query  at  https://nad-support.digilocker.gov.in/. 

We are currently working on establishing a procedure for creating APAAR IDs 

specifically  for  foreign  students.  Your  feedback  will  help  us  address  your 

needs more effectively.

Question 23: What should I do if my 12th mark sheet has not been uploaded 

by my college on DigiLocker? 

Answer:  Please  note  that  data  on  DigiLocker  is  only  uploaded  by  the 

authorized  board  or  university.  You  should  contact  your  college  or  the 

respective  board  and  request  them  to  upload  your  12th  mark  sheet  on 

DigiLocker.

9 

 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 25: अगर !कसी के  पास दOावेज़Q क* हाड( कॉपी नह, है, तो Cा Iडजीलॉकर के

Question 26: Can I save my family members' documents in my DigiLocker? 

Answer: DigiLocker is for individual accounts only. You can only fetch digital 

documents issued in your name. Each family member should create their 

Aadhaar-enabled DigiLocker account and retrieve their own documents. 

Question 27: First of all, I would like to thank the Indian government for this 

initiative. What should I do if a government official is not ready to accept 

documents  issued  from  DigiLocker?  Is  there  a  helpline  number  to  resolve 

this issue? 

Answer: Digital documents issued through DigiLocker are valid and hold the 

same 

legal  status  as  original  documents  when  used  electronically. 

Document in the "Issued document" section of DigiLocker are legally at par 

with  originals  as  per  Section  9A  of  Information  Technology  Act  2000.  They 

should  be  accepted  by  the  concerned  authorities.  We  are  also  actively 

working on increasing awareness and acceptance of these documents with 

various organizations.  

Question 28: Many universities have yet to upload degrees and mark sheets 

for past years. Has the government set any deadline for those issuers? 

Answer: No, there are no fixed deadlines currently. We are still working on 

uploading  legacy  data,  and  it  will  be  completed  soon.  Thank  you  for  your 
patience! 

10 

 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 29: Cा एक ही Iडजीलॉकर ऐप मX दो लोगQ क* आईडी बना सकते हW?

का उपयोग करके  दूसरा =डजीलॉकर खाता बना सकते हC। 

Question  30:  The  10th  and  12th  mark  sheets  of  the  Bihar  Board  are  not 

available after the year 2019. Do you have any information regarding this? 

Answer: Please note that the Bihar School Examination Board has made its 

digital marksheets available only for the years 2018 and 2019, and currently 

only for class X. You can request the Bihar School Examination Board to make 

the mark sheets for other years available. 

Question  31:  After  uploading  my  class  result  data,  I  noticed  that  the 

generated  grade  sheets  are  not  in  any  sequence,  neither  by  enrolment 

number nor by ABC ID. What should I do? 

Answer:  Please  raise  a  ticket  at  https://support.digilocker.gov.in/  and 

provide the following details: 

A scanned copy of the mark sheet/certificate or your full name as it appears 

on the document 

The name of the education board 

The year of passing/session/month 

Roll number/registration number 

Seat number 

The serial number on the document 

Total marks 

11 

 
 
 
 
 
Your registered mobile number 

A screenshot of the error 

This information will help us address your issue more effectively. 

Question 32: Sometimes, after an application update, we are automatically 

logged out and prompted to log in again. Can this issue be resolved? 

Answer: For security reasons, users may be automatically logged out of the 

DigiLocker app following a security update to a new version. This measure is 

implemented to address any potential vulnerabilities and ensure that your 

account remains secure. We appreciate your understanding in this matter. 

Question 33:  How is DigiLocker connected to the APAAR ID, and how can I 

upload credits? 

Answer:  Please  note  that  the  details  associated  with  your  APAAR  ID  are 

fetched from your Aadhaar, while the credit points linked to your APAAR ID 

are  uploaded  solely  by  the  university.  For  more  information,  please  visit: 

abc.gov.in 

Question 34: Sir, can we upload the 12th class 2024 mark sheet now? 

Answer: Please note that data is only uploaded by the authorized board or 

university.  You  can  request  your  board  to  make  the  2024  mark  sheet 

available for uploading. 

Question 35: Can documents uploaded to DigiLocker be used as valid proof 

for government services? 

Answer: Please note that digitally signed documents issued from DigiLocker 

are legally valid as per the IT Act 2000 when used electronically. Therefore, 

they can be accepted as valid proof for various government services. 

12 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  36:  Can  students  upload  documents  themselves 

if  their 

institutions have not uploaded the mark sheets, degrees etc.? 

Answer: We would like to inform you that in order to ensure the authenticity 

and integrity of the documents, only academic institutions are authorized to 

upload data to our platform. This measure is in place to maintain the highest 

standards of accuracy and trustworthiness in the information shared.

Question 39: When I show my documents through the DigiLocker app, some 

police officers or authorities don’t accept them. What should I do? 

Answer: Digital documents issued through DigiLocker are legally valid and 

are considered at par with originals when used electronically. They should 

be  accepted  by  the  concerned  authorities.  We  are  actively  working  with 

various  organizations  to 

increase  awareness  and  ensure  broader 

acceptance of DigiLocker documents.

Question  42: I  passed  my  degree  in  2015,  but  only  education  documents 

from  2019  to  2024  are  available  on  DigiLocker.  How  can  I  download  my 

degree certificate? 

Answer:  Please  raise  a  support  ticket  at  https://support.digilocker.gov.in/ 

and provide the following details: 

A  scanned  copy  of  your  mark  sheet/certificate  or  your  full  name  as  it 

appears on the document 

Roll number/Registration number/Enrolment number 

Year of passing/session 

14 

 
 
 
 
 
 
Course name 

Name of the university 

Your DigiLocker registered mobile number

Question 43: I am a BSc 1st-year student. My APAAR ID starts with 0, and I 

am  facing  issues  with  registration  as  it’s  not  accepting  the  ID.  How  can  I 

resolve this? 

Answer:  Please  raise  a  support  ticket  at  https://support.digilocker.gov.in/ 

and provide the following details: 

A scanned copy of your APAAR ID 

Your DigiLocker registered mobile number 

The name of your college and university 

This will help us verify your details and assist you with the registration issue. 

Question  44: If  I  am  outside  India,  can  I  still  use  DigiLocker  to  access  my 

documents worldwide? 

Answer: Kindly note that if you are availing DigiLocker services outside India, 

you must have an India-based mobile number or a verified email ID. Only 

then can you access DigiLocker services outside of India. 

Question 45: What should I do if my 12th marks sheet is not uploaded by my 

college on Digilocker? 

Answer:  Please  note  that  data  is  only  uploaded  by  the  authorized 

board/university. You can request your board to make the data available. 

15 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 46: Why isn’t Passport available on DigiLocker? 

Answer: Please note that the department responsible for issuing passports 

is not yet integrated with DigiLocker. We will update the portal as soon as it 

becomes available. 

Question 47: What can be done if a student's certificates uploaded by the 

Higher Education Institution (HEI) on DigiLocker can't be retrieved due to a 

name change in Aadhaar, which reflects in DigiLocker, but the certificates 

were issued under the previous name? 

Answer:  Please  contact  your  board  or  university  and  request  them  to 

update  your  name  in  their  records  to  match  your  Aadhaar.  Once  they 

update  your  details  in  DigiLocker,  you  should  be  able  to  access  your 

documents in your DigiLocker account.

16 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 49: Can documents uploaded to DigiLocker be used as valid proof 

for government services? 

Answer: Yes, documents uploaded on DigiLocker are considered valid proof 

for various government services. DigiLocker is an authorized platform under 

the  Ministry  of  Electronics  and  Information  Technology  (MeitY),  and  its 

digitally verified documents are accepted by multiple government agencies 

and services across India. If you encounter any issues, feel free to contact 

DigiLocker support at: https://support.digilocker.gov.in. 

Question 50: Can documents uploaded to DigiLocker be used as valid proof 

for government services? 

Answer:  Digital  documents  issued  through  DigiLocker  are  valid  and 

equivalent to original documents when used electronically. They should be 

accepted  by  the  concerned  authorities.  We  are  continually  working  to 

increase  awareness  and  acceptance  of  DigiLocker  documents  across 

various organizations.

Question  52:  Hi  DigiLocker  team,  what  banking-related  documents  can  I

account  statements,  Form  16,  e-passbooks, 

interest  certificates,  TDS

others.

Question 54: How  is  DigiLocker  awareness  being  spread  among  students 

and teachers at the school and university levels across India?

are  conducted  to  increase  DigiLocker  awareness  among  students  and 

teachers nationwide.

Question 56: If a student wants to update their enrolment number, what is 

the process? 

Answer:  Please  submit  your  query  at  https://support.digilocker.gov.in/ 

along  with  detailed  information  about  your  concern  so  we  can  assist  you 

accordingly. 

18 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 57: Can we expect DigiLocker to have a dark mode? 

Answer: Yes, dark mode is currently available on the web version only. We 

are working to bring dark mode to the mobile app as well.

Question 59: What should I do if my 12th mark sheet is not uploaded by my 

college on DigiLocker? 

Answer:  Please  note  that  data  is  only  uploaded  by  the  authorized 

board/university. You may contact your board and request them to make 

the data available on DigiLocker. 

Question  60:  Sometimes,  traffic  police  deny  accepting  DigiLocker 

documents and ask for a hard copy. What should we do?   

Answer: Digital documents from DigiLocker are legally valid and should be 

accepted  by  authorities.  Efforts  are  ongoing  to  improve  awareness  and 

acceptance of digital documents. 

Question 61: Cा हम Iडजीलॉकर को !कसी भी देश मX उपयोग कर सकते हW?

19 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  62:  Is  it  possible  to  change  any  details  in  my  documents  with 

DigiLocker’s help? 

Answer:  Please  note  that  DigiLocker  only  displays  data  provided  by  the 

relevant departments. For any changes to your documents, please contact 

the issuing department. 

Question  63:  I  am  from  Bihar;  why  aren’t  my  10th  and  12th  certificates 

available in DigiLocker? 

Answer:  Please  note  that  the  Bihar  School  Examination  Board  has  made 

digital  mark  sheets  available  only  for  Class  X  for  2018  and  2019.  You  can 

request  the  Bihar  School  Examination  Board  to  make  the  Class  XII  data 
available. 

Question 64: From Punjab, only education documents from 2019 to 2024 are 

available. How can I download my MCA degree certificate from 2015? 

Answer: Please note that digital awards are made available on DigiLocker 

only when institutions have provided their records to the National Academic 

Depository  (NAD).  You  may  request  your  university  to  provide  its  digital 

records. 

Question 65: I am from Valsad, Gujarat. What should I do if a government 

official refuses to accept a DigiLocker document? Is there a helpline? 

Answer: Digital documents issued through DigiLocker are legally valid and 

equivalent  to  physical  originals  when  used  electronically.  They  should  be 

accepted  by  relevant  authorities.  However,  we  are  actively  working  with 

organizations  to  improve  awareness  and  acceptance  of  these  digital 

documents. 

20 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  66:  Why  isn’t  my  Bihar  Board  mark  sheet  or  certificate  for  the 

2022–23 sessions available on DigiLocker? 

Answer: Once your board uploads your data to DigiLocker, you will be able 

to retrieve your digital documents from the platform. 

Question  67:  What  should  be  done  if  a  student  can't  retrieve  certificates 

from  DigiLocker  due  to  a  name  change  in  Aadhaar,  while  the  certificates 

were issued under the old name? 

Answer: Please contact your board/university and request them to update 

your name in their records as per your Aadhaar. Once they update your data 

in DigiLocker, you will be able to retrieve your documents. 

Question 68: Can documents issued by authorities be revised in the future?  

Answer: Documents can be updated only by the issuing authority. 

Question 69: अगर कोई दOावेज़ Iडजीलॉकर मX अपलोड !कया जाता है और भौ!तक Uप 

मX नह, ले  जाया जाता, तो Cा वह भी वैध होगा? 

Answer:  =डजीलॉकर  के   मा%म  से  जारी  )कए  गए  =ड9जटल  दSावेज  मूल  दSावेज  के

(cid:145)ीकार )कए जाने चा=हए। हम लगतार संगठनU म( इसकB (cid:145)ीकाय8ता बढ़ाने पर काम कर रहे 

हC। 

Question  70:  APOSS  offers  senior  secondary  courses  in  ODL  mode,  and 

students from various secondary boards are admitted across the country. 

How can we verify the authenticity of these secondary certificates? 

Answer: Digital documents issued through DigiLocker are considered valid 

and  are  equivalent  to  originals  when  used  electronically.  They  should  be 
accepted by concerned authorities. We are working to increase awareness 

and acceptance of DigiLocker documents across various organizations. 

21 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  71:  Kindly  update  all  BSEB  and  other  university  certificates  on 

DigiLocker. 

Answer:  Please  note  that  DigiLocker  only  displays  data  received  from  the 

board or university. Once they upload your data, you will be able to retrieve 

your digital documents from DigiLocker. 

Question  72:  Hi,  many  students  have  a  doubt  whether  a  DigiLocker 

certificate can be submitted for admission or job purposes instead of the 

original document. 

Answer:  Yes,  digital  documents  issued  through  DigiLocker  are  valid  and 

equivalent to original documents when used electronically. They should be 

accepted by the concerned authorities for admission, job applications, and 

other  official  purposes.  We  are  also  working  to  increase  awareness  and 

acceptance of DigiLocker documents across various organizations. 

Question 73: I am from Bihar. I am facing difficulty in making my ABC ID card 

because my college, LND College Motihari East Champaran, is not showing 

in the list.   

Answer:  As  your  college/university  name  is  not  yet  published  in  the 

dropdown list, please create your APAAR ID under the "None" category.   

Question 74: यYद छाs आधार मX नाम बदलने के  कारण DigiLocker से uमाणपs uाv 

नह, कर पा रहा है, जब!क uमाणपs पुराने नाम से जारी !कए गए थे, तो Cा !कया जाना 

चाIहए?   

Answer: कृ पया अपने बोड8/)व(cid:138))व(cid:129)ालय से संपक8  कर( और उ(cid:146)( आधार के  अनुसार अपने

अपडेट कर द(गे, तो आप अपने Aमाणपp DigiLocker खाते म( Aाj कर सक( गे।   

22 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 75: Hello sir, there is a problem in fetching documents for married 

students because their Aadhaar name is updated after marriage, but their 

academic name is different. What can we do about this?   

Answer: Please contact the relevant board/university and request them to 

update your name in their records as per your Aadhaar. Once they update 

your data in DigiLocker, you will be able to access your documents in your 

DigiLocker account.   

Question 76: With DigiLocker, will we still need to visit the university to get 

our certificates?   

Answer:  Once  your  university  uploads  your  data  to  DigiLocker,  you  will  be 

able to retrieve your digital certificate from the platform. This digitally signed 

document  is  legally  valid  per  the  IT  Act  2000  when  used  electronically. 

However, if you need a physical copy of your degree certificate, you may still 

need to contact your university.   

Question  77:  The  records  were  uploaded  on  October  15  and  16,  2024.  Is  it 

normal for the process to take this long, or could there be an issue on my 

end?   

Answer: Currently, a high volume of files is being uploaded, and processing 

was delayed for a day or two. While the normal processing time is 48 hours, 

it is taking longer due to the large number of files.   

Question 78: We have all our documents like Aadhaar, driving license, PAN 

card, etc., in our DigiLocker account. Why do institutions like banks still ask 

us for copies of these documents?   

Answer:  Digital  documents  issued  via  DigiLocker  are  legally  valid  and 

equivalent to physical originals when used electronically. They should be  

23 

 
 
 
 
 
 
accepted by the relevant authorities. We are actively working with various 

organizations  to  enhance  awareness  and  promote  the  acceptance  of 

DigiLocker documents. 

Question 79: What should I do if my 12th mark sheet is not uploaded by my 

college on DigiLocker?   

Answer:  Data  is  uploaded  only  by  the  authorized  board  or  university.  You 

can request your board to make your mark sheet available in DigiLocker.   

Question 80: हम देवIरया से हW। DigiLocker Android 10 मX काम नह, करता Cा?  

Answer:  Google  ने  कु छ  सुरEा  उपाय  लागू  )कए  हC,  और  जो  =डवाइस  (cid:130)ूनतम 

आवqकताओ ं  को  पूरा  नह(cid:128)  करते  हC,  वे  DigiLocker  ऐप  के   2लए  सम2थ| त  नह(cid:128)  हC।  ऐप  को 

संचा2लत करने के  2लए Android 10 या बाद के  सं-रणU कB आवqकता होती है। इस बीच, 

आप  अपने  दSावेज़U  तक  पiँचने  के
