[https://www.digilocker.gov.in/] पर जा सकते हC। 

Question 81: What is the perspective on software testing for security, given 

that all software must go through testing?   

Answer:  DigiLocker  follows  standard  software  development  practices, 

including uniform coding standards, guidelines, and reviews. Each release is 

thoroughly  tested  for  security  and  penetration  vulnerabilities  before 

deployment.   

24 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 82: I am from Motihari, LND College. I have created my account on 

DigiLocker, but only my Aadhaar card is downloading; other certificates like 

my 10th and 12th certificates are not available.   

Answer:  Please 

raise  a 

ticket  at  [https://support.digilocker.gov.in/] 

(https://support.digilocker.gov.in/) and share a scanned copy of your mark 

sheet/certificate or your full name on the document, your board/university 

name,  passing  year,  session,  roll  number,  registration  number,  and  other 

details so we can assist further.   

Question  83:  Most  students  face  issues  in  generating  ABC  IDs  through 

DigiLocker because Aadhaar-linked mobile numbers are with parents.   

Answer: You can use options like PAN or driving license to create an ABC ID 

on the ABC website.  

Question 84: IडSजलॉकर पर दOावेज होने के  बाद भी मूल दOावेज Yदखाने पड़ते हW। इसके  

[लए Cा करना चाIहए? 

Answer: =डजीलॉकर से जारी =ड9जटल दSावेज कानूनी Vप से वैध हC और भौ)तक मूल के  

बराबर हC जब इले (cid:143)(cid:144)ॉ2नक उपयोग के  2लए Zदए जाएं गे। संबंrधत अrधका=रयU को इ(cid:146)( (cid:145)ीकार 

करना चा=हए, और हम जागVकता और (cid:145)ीकृ )त बढ़ाने पर काम कर रहे हC। 

Question 85: Sikkim Manipal University enrolls foreign students. How can we 

help them register for an APAAR ID without Aadhaar?   

Answer: Please raise your query at [https://nad-support.digilocker.gov.in/] 

(https://nad-support.digilocker.gov.in/). We are working on a procedure for 

creating APAAR IDs for foreign students.   

25 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  86:  Many  students  are  unsure  if  a  DigiLocker  certificate  can  be 

submitted for admission or job purposes instead of the original one.   

Answer:  DigiLocker-issued  digital  documents  are  valid  and  equivalent  to 

originals when used electronically. They should be accepted by concerned 

authorities,  and  we  are  working  to  increase  awareness  and  acceptance 

among organizations.   

Question 87: By knowing a person’s ABC ID, can someone access their other 

documents?   

Answer:  No,  knowing  the  ABC/APAAR  ID  alone  does  not  provide  access  to 

other documents.   

Question 88: What is the process for transferring a student’s credits from 

one university to another during a course?   

Answer:  Credit  transfer  between  universities  follows  the  National  Credit 

Framework (NCrF) norms. 

Question 89: What should I do if my 12th mark sheet is not uploaded by my 

college on DigiLocker? 

Answer: Once your board uploads your data on DigiLocker, you will be able 

to retrieve your digital documents from the platform. 

Question 90: How safe is DigiLocker if my mobile phone is stolen? 

Answer: Kindly set an MPIN for your DigiLocker account. To do this, log in to 

the DigiLocker app, tap "Menu" at the bottom of the screen, go to "Settings," 

select "Security," and set your 4-digit MPIN. 

26 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 91: How does DigiLocker encourage private companies to accept 

digital documents for KYC processes? 

Answer:  Digital  documents  issued  via  DigiLocker  are  legally  valid  and 

equivalent to physical originals when used electronically. We actively work 

with  various  organizations  to  increase  awareness  and  promote  the 

acceptance of these digital documents. 

Question  92:    If  Aadhaar  is  not  mandatory,  how  does  DigiLocker  ensure 

security for user authentication? 

Answer:  DigiLocker  uses  multifactor  authentication  based  on  document 

validation for authenticating users. To protect citizens’ accounts, the system 

only  permits  access  when  names  on  Aadhaar  and  DigiLocker  documents 

match exactly. This ensures rightful ownership of documents. 

Question 93: Does the Gateway in DigiLocker access or store user data? 

Answer: The Gateway in DigiLocker acts as a secure intermediary, enabling 

document transmission and exchange between DigiLocker and authorized 

organizations without accessing or storing user data. 

Question  94:  Can  the  same  document  exist  in  both  the  'Issued'  and 

'Uploaded' sections on DigiLocker? 

Answer:  Yes,  the  same  document  can  exist  in  both  sections.  The  Issued 

Documents  section  contains  digitally  signed,  legally  valid  documents 

directly  from  authorized  issuers,  while  the  Uploaded  Documents  section 

(DigiLocker Drive) is personal storage for digitized copies. We recommend 

using documents from the Issued Documents section for official purposes. 

27 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 95:  Why  is  manual  upload  of  certificates  still  required  for  some 

competitive exams and university admissions? 

Answer: Digital documents issued through DigiLocker are legally valid and 

equivalent  to  original  documents  when  used  electronically.  However, 

DigiLocker  is  working  to  increase  awareness  and  acceptance  of  these 

documents with various organizations. 

Question 96: Is DigiLocker data shared or sold to third parties? 

Answer:  DigiLocker  only  acts  as  a  secure  intermediary  for  document 

transmission  between  DigiLocker  and  authorized  organizations.  When 

accessed  via  third-party  applications,  documents  are  shared  only  with 

verified online consent. 

Question  97:    Why  are  there  both  APAAR  and  ABC  IDs,  and  is  there  a 

difference? 

Answer: APAAR and ABC IDs refer to the same unique ID, with the Ministry of 

Education renaming the ABC ID to APAAR ID. You can use your APAAR ID for 

all academic-related activities. 

Question  98:    What  is  DigiLocker’s  approach  to  software  security  during 

testing? 

Answer:  DigiLocker  follows  standard  software  development  practices, 

including uniform coding standards, guidelines, and reviews. Every release 

undergoes thorough internal review and testing for security and penetration 

vulnerabilities before deployment. 

28 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 99:  Can DigiLocker certificates be submitted for admissions or job 

applications instead of original ones? 

Answer: Digital documents from DigiLocker are legally valid as per the IT Act 

2000  and  equivalent  to  original  documents  when  used  electronically. 

However,  we  are  working  to  increase  awareness  and  acceptance  of  such 

documents. 

Question 100:  How do I change my mobile number in DigiLocker? 

Answer: First, link your new mobile number to your Aadhaar. Afterward: 

  1. Sign in with your mobile number and security PIN. 

  2. Click "Try using Aadhaar OTP instead" at the bottom of the page. 

  3. Enter the OTP sent to your Aadhaar-registered mobile number. 

  4. After logging in, go to the profile section and edit your mobile number. 

  5. Enter your new number and verify with OTP. 

Question 101:  If a student’s name is missing on the ABC ID, how can it be 

resolved? 

Answer:  If  the  student  is  not  using  Samarth,  they  can  complete  eKYC  in 

DigiLocker, which should update the name to match the Aadhaar name. 

Question 102:  Can DigiLocker help prevent fake certificates and degrees? 

Answer:  Digital  documents  issued  via  DigiLocker  are  legally  valid  and 

equivalent  to  physical  originals  when  used  electronically.  Organizations 

using DigiLocker’s services can validate documents online, while others may 

still require paper copies. 

29 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 103: If an institution uploads an incorrect grade sheet, can it be re-

uploaded with the correct data?   

Answer: Yes, documents can be updated only by the issuing authority. 

Question  104:  How  can  I  use  my  linked  ABC  card  and  DigiLocker  to  take 

courses from other institutions?   

Answer:  ABC  provides  academic  credit  deposit  accounts  for  students  in 

recognized Higher Education Institutes (HEI). Academic credits earned are 

automatically  credited  to  your  account,  which  can  be  accumulated  and 

redeemed  for  academic  programs  at  any  time,  enabling  you  to  pursue 

courses across different institutions. 

Question  105:  My  Aadhaar  name  changed  after  marriage,  but  my  credit 

mark sheet has my previous name, so my documents aren’t uploading to 

DigiLocker. Is there a solution?   

Answer: In cases of name mismatches, DigiLocker cannot fetch documents. 

The name on your document must match the name on your Aadhaar. 

Question  106:  If  a  student  leaves  their  course  mid-session  due  to  some 

issue, does the ABC card help?   

Answer: Yes, credits earned can be saved in the student’s ABC account, and 

they can redeem these credits if they resume their education later. 

Question  107:  Is  Aadhaar  the  only  document  required  for  DigiLocker 

verification?   

Answer:  Aadhaar  eKYC  is  mandatory  for  fetching  documents  in  your 

DigiLocker account. 

30 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question 108: I’m unable to create my APAAR ID despite multiple attempts; 

what can I do?   

Answer:  Students  under  the  age  of  16  cannot  create  their  APAAR  ID  via 

DigiLocker. For assistance, please contact your school. 

Question  109:    Are  documents  in  DigiLocker  encrypted,  like  WhatsApp’s 

end-to-end encryption?   

Answer: Yes, DigiLocker uses high standards for privacy and data security, 

with encryption at rest and in transfer to protect and secure all data. 

Question 110:  Why doesn’t DigiLocker show the full Aadhaar number?   

Answer: For security reasons, UIDAI issues Digital Aadhaar in this format. For 

more details, please contact UIDAI directly. 

Question 111: If my Aadhaar card does not have a mobile number, how can 

I open a DigiLocker account?   

Answer: Link a new mobile number to your Aadhaar at the nearest Aadhaar 

Enrolment Center, as DigiLocker requires an OTP sent to your Aadhaar-linked 

mobile number. 

Question 112: Are DigiLocker and APAAR ID the same, or are they different?   

Answer: DigiLocker and APAAR ID are different but integrated to provide a 

secure way to store and access academic documents. 

31 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question  113:  Are  there  any  fees  for  creating  an  APAAR/ABC  ID  through 

DigiLocker or other portals?   

Answer: There  are  no  charges  associated  with  creating  an  APAAR/ABC  ID 

through DigiLocker, ABC, or UDISE portals. 

Question 114: How can we upload mark sheets for students with arrears who 

complete later semesters?   

Answer:  Separate  mark  sheets  can  be  uploaded  by  the  institution  for 

students in such cases. 

Question 115: How can academic researchers contribute to the DigiLocker 

project?   

Answer:  Academic  researchers  can  provide  feedback  and  suggestions 

through  the  DigiLocker  support  portal,  which  may  help  enhance  the 

platform. 

Question 116:  शादी के  बाद लड़!कयQ का नाम आधार मX बदल जाता है ले !कन माक( शीट 

मX पुराना नाम होता है, ऐसे मX डॉCूमXwस अपलोड नह, होते हW।   

Answer: DigiLocker म( डॉXूम((cid:148)स को सही से फे च करने के  2लए नाम का 2मलान होना 

आवqक है। अगर आधार म( और डॉXूम((cid:148)स म( नाम का मेल नह(cid:128) होगा, तो डॉXूम((cid:148)स फे च 

नह(cid:128) )कए जा सक( गे। 

Question  117:  How  effective  is  DigiLocker  in  addressing  the  issue  of  fake 

documents, certificates, and degrees?   

Answer: DigiLocker authorizes agencies to access documents directly from 

the  owner’s  account,  and  documents  can  be  directly  uploaded  by 

authorized bodies, reducing the chances of fake documents. 

32

Apply Now 2026

Debate Competition

Event Date – 29 March, 2022

Time: 11:00 AM-2:00 PM

Organised by- EXPRESSIONS – The Debating Club , School of Liberal Arts (SLA), Noida International University.

Name of Competition – The Ideas of Bhagat Singh are Still Relevant in Contemporary World

Venue: SLA, Academic Block

Short Description of the Competition:

The debate competition was held in remembrance of Shahid-e-Azam Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev and Rajguru. This event was organised for bringing out the oratory skills of the participants.  Participants can express their ideas, emotions, and talent in name of creativity. The difference of opinions is the backbone of the democracy.

Total number of registered Participants

Registered Participants from School of Liberal Arts

13

13

Judge Details:

S.no

Name

Organization

Expertise

Email Id

Mobile No.

1

Dr.Ruchika Gupta

Director School of Business Management, NIU

12

School of Liberal Arts

13

Avanish Upadhyay

School of Liberal Arts

Process Followed:

The rules of EXPRESSIONS- The Debating Club were:

The debate must be in English and Hindi.

Each team has two or three constructive speeches, and two to three rebuttal speeches. The affirmative gives the first constructive speech, and the rebuttals alternate: negative, affirmative, negative, affirmative. The affirmative has both the first and last speeches of the debate.

No new constructive arguments may be introduced in the rebuttal period. The affirmative must, if possible, reply to the major negative arguments before the last rebuttal.

In the questioning period, the questioner may ask any fair, clear question that has a direct bearing on the debate. The questioner may use the period to build up any part of his own case, to tear down any part of his opposition’s case, or to ascertain facts, such as the opposition’s position on a certain issue, that can be used later in the debate. The questioner must confine himself to questions and not make statements, comments, or ask rhetorical questions.

Dr. Ruchika Gupta Director School of Business Management, Esteemed Judge addressed the students and declared the results thereafter.

The results of debating competition:

Winner: Sunika Adhikari- Department of International Relations, NIU.

1 st Runner up: Priyanshu Singh- Department of Political Science NIU.

2 nd Runner up: Avnish Upadhyay – Department of Political Science NIU

Feedback from Participants:

All the participants who came for the event expressed that such events should be organized at the regular interval. All the participants were very happy with the opportunity that Noida International University had provided them. The problem that some students faced were that of sitting space. But they had a good experience . There were many responses from the participants, and they were positive and reflected the upbeat mood.

Faculty Coordinators:

Deepak Kataria Secretary Debating Club

Moin Khan Member Debating Club

Apply Now 2026

Webinar on – Basic Principle of Nuclear Medicine & Common Clinical Applications

Department of Radiology, School of Allied Health Sciences, Noida International University is going to organize a Webinar – Basic Principle of Nuclear Medicine & Common Clinical Applications.

Guest Speaker – Mr Deepak Aheer (Nuclear Medicine Physicist & AERB/BARC, Certified RSO and Manager – Business Development of Medical Cyclotron)

Date – 28th May 2022

Time – 2:30pm to 4pm

The objectives of the webinar are:

To understand the basic principle of nuclear medicine.

Understand production of radionuclides.

Get knowledge about the modalities used in nuclear medicine.

To know the common application of nuclear medicine.

Analyse the importance of nuclear medicine in treatment.

Contact Us

Admission Helpline : (+91) 8745862200 (+91) 0120-4862200

Email Id : admissions@niu.edu.in internationaladmissions@niu.edu.in

How YouTube Works

OUR MISSION

To give everyone a voice and show them the world

We believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that
                  the world is a better place when we listen, share and build
                  communities through our stories.

Explore this site to learn more about how YouTube makes all
                  this happen.

QUICK LINKS

WHAT'S NEW

20 ways that we're celebrating two decades of YouTube

Pop the confetti, because YouTube is turning 20! From the
                      19-second clip that started it all, to now over 20 billion
                      uploaded videos,1 including music, Shorts, podcasts and
                      more, we've grown so much in just two decades.
                      We're kicking off our birthday with plenty of ways to
                      celebrate. Take a peek at some of our new features, stats,
                      hidden gems and easter eggs below to help you join in on
                      the festivities:

YouTube and industry leaders announce the Youth Digital
                      Wellbeing Initiative

A message from Neal Mohan, YouTube CEO: Today, YouTube is
                      pleased to join over a dozen regional content creators and
                      distributors representing ten countries to participate in
                      the Youth Digital Wellbeing Initiative, supporting a
                      unified vision for the development of high-quality,
                      age-appropriate content for young people.

From the YouTube CEO: Our big bets for 2025

This year marks YouTube's 20th birthday. In two
                      decades, YouTube has transformed culture through video and
                      built a thriving creative economy. Today's creators
                      have moved from filming grainy videos of themselves on
                      desktop computers to building studios and producing
                      popular talk shows and feature-length films. And people
                      aren't just watching YouTube on their computers or
                      phones. TV has surpassed mobile and is now the primary
                      device for YouTube viewing in the US (by watch time),1 and
                      according to Nielsen, YouTube has been number one in
                      streaming watch time in the US for two years.2 And while
                      it's still early days, AI is making a big difference
                      in how people create and consume content on YouTube.
